    • Method Detail

      • amp

        public void amp​(float amp)
        Description copied from class: SoundObject
        Change the amplitude/volume of this sound.
        Overrides:
        amp in class SoundObject
        Parameters:
        amp - A float value between 0.0 (complete silence) and 1.0 (full volume) controlling the amplitude/volume of this sound.

      • channels

        public int channels​()
        Returns the number of channels in the sound file.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of channels in the sound file (1 for mono, 2 for stereo)

      • cue

        public void cue​(float time)
        Cues the playhead to a fixed position in the soundfile.
        Parameters:
        time - Position to start from in seconds.

      • duration

        public float duration​()
        Returns the duration of the the soundfile.
        Returns:
        Returns the duration of the file in seconds.

      • rate

        public void rate​(float rate)
        Change the playback rate of the soundfile.
        Parameters:
        rate - This method changes the playback rate of the soundfile. 1 is the original speed. 0.5 is half speed and one octave down. 2 is double the speed and one octave up.

      • resize

        public void resize​(int frames,
                   boolean stereo)
        Parameters:
        frames -
        stereo -

      • sampleRate

        public int sampleRate​()
        Returns the sample rate of the soundfile.
        Returns:
        Returns the sample rate of the soundfile as an int.

      • set

        public void set​(float rate,
                float pos,
                float amp,
                float add)
        Set multiple parameters at once
        Parameters:
        rate - The playback rate of the original file.
        pos - The panoramic position of the player as a float from -1.0 to 1.0.
        amp - The amplitude of the player as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
        add - A value for modulating other audio signals.

      • stop

        public void stop​()
        Stops the player
        Overrides:
        stop in class SoundObject

      • position

        public float position​()
        Get current sound file playback position in seconds.
        Returns:
        The current position of the sound file playback in seconds (TODO seconds at which sample rate?)

      • percent

        public float percent​()
        Get current sound file playback position in percent.
        Returns:
        The current position of the sound file playback in percent (a value between 0 and 100).

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying​()
        Check whether this soundfile is currently playing.
        Overrides:
        isPlaying in class SoundObject
        Returns:
        `true` if the soundfile is currently playing, `false` if it is not.

      • pause

        public void pause​()
        Stop the playback of the file, but cue it to the current position so that the next call to play() will continue playing where it left off.

      • read

        public void read​(float[] data)
        Get the current sample data and write it into the given array. The array has to be able to store as many floats as there are frames in this sample (or twice as many if this is a stereo sample).
        Parameters:
        data - the target array to write the sample data to

      • read

        public void read​(int startFrame,
                 float[] data,
                 int startIndex,
                 int numFrames)

      • write

        public void write​(float[] data)
        Overwrite the sample with the data from the given array. The array can contain up to as many floats as there are frames in this sample (or twice as many if this is a stereo sample).
        Parameters:
        data - the array from which the sample data should be taken

      • write

        public void write​(int startFrame,
                  float[] data,
                  int startIndex,
                  int numFrames)
